description: Sven Halek privately urges the Council to take decisive action, arguing that systemic uncertainty is unsustainable. He proposes triggering a public, dramatic countdown to potential BCI shutdown if the city cannot agree on a new, inclusive charter.

A tense emergency broadcast, scripted by Sven, announces a two-week countdown to full BCI shutdown unless a new protocol with citywide backing emerges. Panic mixes with resolve, as the public realizes the stakes.

Neighborhood assemblies and public forums emerge across Stenograd. Activists, officials, and 'ghost citizens' debate governance models, pushed by Sven's messaging about collective responsibility and transformation.

Cross-faction leaders—Oksana, Lenart, Rada, and others—forge an urgent consensus on a radically inclusive city charter, featuring score amnesty and rotating neighborhood leadership, under extreme deadline pressure.

The new charter is adopted hours before the countdown ends. BCI controls vanish and neighborhood assemblies step in as interim authority. A final message from Halden, broadcast citywide, frames this handoff as planned collective self-rule, not collapse.
